line-9: Network Rail have an opportunity for the right candidate to become part of our Capital Delivery Eastern team as a Capital Programme Planning Assurance Analyst This is an exciting unique opportunity for a committed, highly motivated & enthusiastic individual to join our Planning Assurance team. As a Planning Assurance Analyst your role will be to support the business to ensure successful delivery of our projects. As an integral part of the business the Planning Assurance team are responsible for assuring project plans across the Major Projects Portfolio (MPP) â€“ including Beaulieu New Station and Cambridge South Infrastructure Enhancement (CSIE). This full time role is based in our Stratford office, with a requirement to work out of this location three days per week minimum.
line-11: Day to day, your activities will include: Ensuring project plans are submitted within agreed timeframes & stays in sync with periodic deliverables & Network Rail processes & standards. Monitoring project plan key performance milestones and supply periodic progress reports/dashboards. Manage data assurance activities; verify data requirements undertake analysis, identify trends & review, and interpret analysis. Use of Acumen FUSE to compile FUSE metrics to report schedule health checks on project plans. Maintain the NR schedule adherence milestones within the Primavera P6 programmes on key projects. Working with the NR Portfolio Managers & Supply Chain to ensure good baseline management is in place & supply support for change control process across projects. Organise periodic meetings with the supply chain/NR project teams to review & discuss FUSE dashboard outputs. Provide Planning Assurance support & guidance to the Programme & Portfolio Managers. We're looking for someone who can demonstrate the following essential criteria: Relevant successful experience in the planning and delivery of construction/engineering projects Relevant successful experience in using a number of project management scheduling tools & techniques including Primavera and Acumen Fuse. Microsoft Excel Demonstrable skills in initiating and building positive working relationships with customers, their team and stakeholders. Ability to display and communicate work clearly Proactive and capable of using own initiative Inquisitive, curious, and a desire to explore and investigate large datasets Desirable criteria Knowledge of MS Power Bi & Power Pivots
